entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French claimer, clamer, from Latin clamare to cry out, shout; akin to Latin calare to call low

def.dt: :to ask for especially as a right claimed the inheritance
:to call for :require this matter claims our attention
:take 16b the accident claimed her life
:to take as the rightful owner
:to assert in the face of possible contradiction :maintain claimed that he'd been cheated
:to claim to have organization … which claims 11,000 … members Rolling Stone
:to assert to be rightfully one's own claimed responsibility for the attack
:a demand for something due or believed to be due an insurance claim
:a right to something
:a title to a debt, privilege, or other thing in the possession of another
:an assertion open to challenge a claim of authenticity
:something that is claimed
:a tract of land staked out
:the area in an airport where arriving passengers pick up their checked baggage
:a claim against a party on the same side of a legal action
:to mark the limits of by or as if by stakes
:to tether to a stake
:bet wager
:to fasten up or support (as plants) with stakes
:to back financially
:grubstake
:to assert a title or right to something by or as if by placing stakes usually to satisfy a legal requirement
